content.rendered:
Photo via Unsplash

Hey all, there’s present shopping and colds and last minute project closing going on, but I’ve still got a mini update for you this week as we head into Christmas.

(And my sincere apologies if I missed your cool thing this week (due to me hardly spending much time in front of a computer), but please do share it in the comments below).

Let’s get to it.

Genesis 2.2.5 released

Two quick updates of the Genesis Framework happened this week to a fix an issue with WordPress 4.4 causing some minor issues with the styling of the Genesis Theme Settings admin page and some other small bugs and fixes.

Genesis 2.2.4 now available. Update now with one click in your dashboard! https://t.co/Ta2uHxyfvc #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) December 16, 2015

#GenesisWP 2.2.5 is out, addresses issue with entries not honoring selected layout. You can update now!

— Nathan Rice (@nathanrice) December 17, 2015

Themes

Latest update on his Digital Pro theme from Brian Gardner.

Working on this — https://t.co/GHL83VjGqN #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) December 11, 2015

A new theme coming soon from the folks over at ZigZagPress.

coming soon #genesiswp #zigzagpress pic.twitter.com/iQQeYAruKf

— zigzagpress.com (@zigzagpress) December 18, 2015

An update from Jesse Petersen’s GenesisThe.me project.

Will be releasing some cool mobile-first products with or before our first theme. News forthcoming. #genesiswp

— GenesisThe.me (@_GenesisTheme) December 13, 2015

News that the forthcoming Sunshine Pro Genesis theme a version which supports popular page builder plugin, Beaver Builder.

Upcoming Sunshine Pro Genesis theme will have additional version for @BeaverBuilder users – watch out 😉 #genesiswp #WordPress

— Simple Pro Themes (@SimpleProThemes) December 16, 2015

Showcase

I have a house full of ill people and so no time for detailed showcase research this week I’m afraid, but I did just want to give a shout out to this nice looking site from Kevin Whelan for wallmanarchitects.com

Launched a clean, minimal new website for a client today: https://t.co/QUaEPmMUcL #webdesign #minimal #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/NScuoQtQQc

— KEVIN WHELAN (@_kvnw) December 11, 2015

Best of the rest

Brian Gardner did an AMA over at ManageWP.org and gave some great answers.

The @bgardner AMA has started! The founder of @studiopress will be answering #WordPress and @St arbucks questions https://t.co/EfURhXtZpx

— ManageWP (@managewp) December 16, 2015

Mike Hemberger shares a flexbox grid column generator for Genesis.

Handy grid column calculator. More flexible then others i’ve seen, and percentage based. https://t.co/dLpQFmjTCJ #webdev #webdesign

— Mike Hemberger (@JiveDig) December 15, 2015

Nice article from Matthew Snider, Learning From The Best – The Genesis Community.

Learning From The Best – The Genesis Community – https://t.co/EEXRf1oHyf #GenesisWP

— Matthew Snider (@matthewfsnider) December 10, 2015

You just can’t keep a good man down and Calvin Koepke is no exception with a tutorial on How to Build a Custom Login Page in Genesis.

New tutorial: How to Build a Custom Login Page in Genesis — https://t.co/wm2TDP2bXD #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/TXnR4IE4eh

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) December 17, 2015

…check out his Developer Lounge, if you didn’t already.

Introducing the Developer Lounge and The Work Life Newsletter — https://t.co/owJ1P2wwq9 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/hRClWhfvv3

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) December 11, 2015

…he’s also put up some demo links of his awesome free themes.

Requested and delivered. Demo links for free theme downloads are now available — https://t.co/o772kLxcdk #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/vjeggl2P6R

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) December 16, 2015

…and a reminder that he’s also building a community of Genesis lovers over on Medium too, why not join in?

The Genesis Framework on @Medium now has over 50 followers! Interested in posting? — https://t.co/mb7hRZuSvg #genesiswp

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) December 16, 2015

Sridhar’s on the case as usual (PS Happy Birthday for this week :), with two tutorials.

How to add an additional Footer widget area in Altitude Pro: https://t.co/v7uUkc5C6s #GenesisWP

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) December 15, 2015

How to display Genesis eNews Extended opt-in form in a timed popup: https://t.co/SETGF55XA7 pic.twitter.com/JiXQGZXtfs

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) December 13, 2015

The Genesis Community’s very own Gary Jones is joining the WP Developers Club as Chief Compliance Officer.

@GaryJ Gary Jones is now in-house driving quality, standards, and excellence at #TheWPDC https://t.co/xTUWP2s6gh #WordPress #GenesisWP

— WP Developers Club (@thewpdc) December 15, 2015

[EDIT (23 Dec 2015): Somehow I missed Genesis contributor Rian Rietveld also joining WPDC as Director of Web Accessibility, congrats Rian!]

Big News #WordPress -> @RianRietveld has joined #TheWPDC as Director of Web Accessibility https://t.co/toprpwmGID #GenesisWP #accessibility

— WP Developers Club (@thewpdc) December 17, 2015

Plus, Tonya over at the WP Developers Club wants to hear from Genesis folk.

Hey #WordPress & #GenesisWP Developers -> Talk to us. Tell us what you want in education https://t.co/kjmh0TH2IR @thewpdc

— Tonya Mork (@hellofromTonya) December 16, 2015

Cobalt Apps pushes out an update of their Dynamik Website Builder.

Just pushed out Dynamik 1.9.3 https://t.co/yBMQi5RKpQ #wordpress #genesiswp

— Cobalt Apps (@cobaltapps) December 17, 2015

And finally…

If you’ve got a few minutes to spare, why not enter the Christmas spirit and give the gift of your time over on the StudioPress forums this weekend.

Hey #GenesisWP peeps – I'm on a mission to help as many users as possible. Who wants to answer some posts? #58 https://t.co/A3FNGBDSI9

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) December 18, 2015

That’s all for This Week in Genesis, for the Christmas holiday period at least, but stay tuned as I’m hoping to share one or two interviews with good people from the Genesis community over at Christmas too (subscribe if you don’t already to get notified of those).

It just remains for me to say, thank you to everyone for your support this year, you make GenesisWP.guide awesome.

Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year.

excerpt.rendered: Genesis 2.2.5 released, Brian Gardner does an AMA, and Gary Jones & Rian Rietveld join the WP Developers Club.
